verses.verse: (A Song of Praise to the Sovereign LORD) The LORD ((Ps. 96:10)) reigns; Let the earth rejoice; Let the multitude of isles be glad!
(Ex. 19:9; Deut. 4:11; 1 Kin. 8:12; Ps. 18:11) Clouds and darkness surround Him; ((Ps. 89:14)) Righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.
(Ps. 18:8; Dan. 7:10; Hab. 3:5) A fire goes before Him, And burns up His enemies round about.
(Ex. 19:18) His lightnings light the world; The earth sees and trembles.
(Ps. 46:6; Amos 9:5; Mic. 1:4; Nah. 1:5) The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the LORD, At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
(Ps. 19:1) The heavens declare His righteousness, And all the peoples see His glory.
((Ex. 20:4)) Let all be put to shame who serve carved images, Who boast of idols. ((Heb. 1:6)) Worship Him, all you gods.
Zion hears and is glad, And the daughters of Judah rejoice Because of Your judgments, O LORD.
For You, LORD, are (Ps. 83:18) most high above all the earth; (Ex. 18:11; Ps. 95:3; 96:4) You are exalted far above all gods.

You who love the LORD, ((Ps. 34:14; Prov. 8:13; Amos 5:15; Rom. 12:9)) hate evil! (Ps. 31:23; 145:20; Prov. 2:8) He preserves the souls of His saints; (Ps. 37:40; Jer. 15:21; Dan. 3:28) He delivers them out of the hand of the wicked.
(Job 22:28; Ps. 112:4; Prov. 4:18) Light is sown for the righteous, And gladness for the upright in heart.
(Ps. 33:1) Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous, (Ps. 30:4) And give thanks at the remembrance of His holy name.
